p: Two previous reviews explored the chemistry of T. minuta EOs [ 55, 56] and identified ( Z)-β-ocimene, dihydrotagetone, ( E)-β-ocimene, ( Z)- and ( E)-tagetones, and ( Z)- and ( E)-tagetenones as the major components of the aerial parts. The ( E)-β-ocimene content varied quite extensively across the studies. In one study, it was observed that drying the plant material prior to distillation changed the chemistry of the EO. Both EOs contained ( E)-tagetenone, ( Z)-β-ocimene, and ( Z)-tagetone; however, the fresh plant contained larger amounts of ( Z)-tagetenone, limonene, and allocimene, while the dried plant was characterized by a high content of dihydrotagetone.
